Review:

Scholarships are provided for students who belongs to a reserved category. It takes a lot of running to different offices. But event you will get the scholarship on time.

Name: AASTIK NAGPAL
College: Thapar Institute of Engineering and Technology - [Thapar University]
Heading: Honest review of Thapar University
Review: Saturnalia is the biggest event that takes place in September. Frosh events take place for the freshies in the month of August. Thapar has a very large library and has many types of books, literature, course textbooks, historical books, books for preparation of competitive examinations. The classrooms and library are fully air-conditioned, lecture halls have a capacity of near about 200 students and there are speakers in the classrooms so that the students can easily listen to what the teacher says. The college has several playgrounds and a well-maintained athletic track. Students can play a variety of games like Table tennis, football, cricket, badminton, lawn tennis, volleyball, hockey, and many more. The sports department also organizes various sporting events urja, inter-hostel tournaments, inter-branch toy=urnaments, etc. There are many clubs and societies of different genres like drama society, dance society, society for educational purposes, sports, etc.

Name: Sorabh Goyal
Heading: DELHI UNIVERSITY - A GREAT HEADSTART
Review:
Commerce students (who are interested in accounting) can start from C.An office in order to get hands-on experience.
These offices hire college-level students and give work based on students’ knowledge. As you are in the second year of your course most probably you will be given work related to preparing journals and ledgers. With time auditing and taxation will come into the picture.
This will give you a brief idea of how the process of booking keeping, auditing, and taxation is carried on.
You will get incentives too.
After your graduation, if you apply for some job it will give you an upper hand over other job seekers.

Name: Rahul Suryawanshi
Heading: MAHARASHTRA DAYANAND COLLEGE OF ARTS LATUR
Review:
Dayanand Education Society was established in 1961 to impart higher educationin to the students of this rural area is offers education in English as well as the Marathi medium.
The college is an authorized  centre of the institute of chartered accountants of India (ICAI) for CA Examination.

Name: Harsh Vats
Heading: College criteria for all student
Review: The course is theoretical due to which there is less scope for us in the real world. The faculty members are highly qualified and educated. The professors have completed their degrees in MSc and Ph.D. from well-renowned universities from across the globe. They help us in clearing our doubts on a regular basis by providing weekly doubt sessions. The faculty-to-student ratio is good. Two-semester exams are conducted in a year and it is very easy to score an 8+ GPA even after studying 1 week before the exam including practicals.

Name: Aditya
College: Madhav Institute of Technology and Science - [MITS]
Heading: Honest review of mits gwalior
Review:
There are many official and unofficial groups in WhatsApp then there is a senior-junior guidance group. Then there is a placement process group in telegram. Seniors make these groups work to help us gel with them.
The annual fest isn't good here tech fest is quite good and you shall be given a chance to present it in IITs if ur experiments are good. 
The classroom has all the basic needs library has all the books in need and the faculty gives total support. 
Sports is at a good level but extracurricular activities are really not visible on campus.

Name: Rajat singh
Heading: I love my college
Review: There's a lot of fests conducted in our college like anubhuti and all there are lot of events to participate in college our annual fest is held in main campus a big DJ night with celebrities it's great fun out there we enjoyed it a lot. College provides all the sports and extracurricular activities we don't have playgrounds but college takes sports complex on rent for our play. Also, there are lots of groups and clubs for dramas and dancing and sports etc

Name: Mausam Kumar Badal
College: IIM Mumbai (NITIE) Indian Institute of Management
Heading: NITIE- HEAVEN ON EARTH
Review: Final placements start in 6th trimester and they arrange a placement week and companies are called as per the students choice and they are also given slots according to students choice. Most of the placements are finished within 3 days and allmost all the students are place by 5th day. If few students are still left due to various reasons like low performance, they also get placements very soon. The package offered is really good with minimum of 8-9 LPA to 60-70 lpa.

Name: Student (Anonymous)
Heading: Internship Opportunities
Review: They provide excellent placement training. The students get their placements from fifth semester. Most of the students get placed in their 7th semester. the minimum package is 3.5 LPA and maximum package as of now is 21 LPA. Almost 97% of students get placed.Students are getting placed in a good company with very good salary packages.

Name: Haren Joshi
College: SP Jain Institute of Management and Research - [SPJIMR]
Heading: SP Jain: An MBA student's dream
Review: SPJIMR's courses have international accreditations. Strong industrial engagement also implies a creative curriculum. The professors are usually helpful and supportive. They are professional and experienced and teach very well. The online infrastructure and library is top notch. All books, journals and research papers are made available to us.

Name: Manohar Sharma
Heading: NIT Raipur Review
Review: The campus life of the college is good. More focus of the faculty is towards academic studies. There are 5 fests E-Summit by Entrepreneurship Cell- about the industrial changes in the industry, Aavartan by Technocracy- technical fest, Samar by Shaurya (Sports Committee)- sports competition, Shruti by Raagaa (Music Club)- music festival, and Eclectika by Cultural Club-cultural fest. TEDx talk is also organised by the college. The college provides an ample environment for learning. The library is full of books from all types of authors academic and non-academic. The campus life of NIT Raipur is brilliant.

Name: Sunny Kumar
Heading: LD the best ROI
Review:
No specific annual fest.
But lakshya edutech fest is the tech fest of LD college which is quite average as nothing many innovative things are there.
It is generally conducted in February but due to COVID-19, it is being delayed.
Books related to academics are available easily in the library but other than that not many books are there.
But overall the library is good.
Classrooms are clean and quiet with simple facilities like fan blackboard and extra stuff.
Overall good.
The campus size is around 60 acres and many sports facilities are available like cricket, badminton court, volleyball ball, etc.
There are multiple clubs run by college students-
1)Robocop club(for robotics)
2)coders club( for coding)
3)Mind palace (quiz club).

Name: Ayachi Agarwal
College: Goenka College of Commerce and Business Administration
Heading: Goenka College
Review: In order to achieve my career goal and get managerial jobs, I had opted to do Mcom because they are highly preferred for the same. If we talk about the teachers are here they are very sincere and well qualified and talk nothing apart from studies. They are very knowledgeable and their teaching method is too good. Semester exams are held in January and August which is difficult and u have to study hard to pass.

Name: Abdur Hussain
Heading: AMC my dream
Review: It's only 50000 costs in 1 yr and 3000 per yr for later 3 yr which is very less where private college take 10-20 lakh per ye for MBBS. There is a scholarship available for local students and a loan on mbbs degree education loan given by many banks. Our college campus has 2 banks state Bank of India & the United of India.

Name: BHAVITHA K kadaru
Heading: Ineternships are worth it
Review: I am into this course i.e, computer science because there are vast opportunities to get into it after graduation. And the curriculum in CVR is very good that every detail of the subject will be properly covered and you'll be guided perfectly by the concerned faculty. Every faculty is highly qualified and have good communication skills so there isn't any doubt for me totally while choosing this college. The semesters will be conducted every 6 months and there will be a midterm for every 2 months in between semesters where the syllabus is split into half for both the terms so that the entire syllabus will be covered before we write the end semester exam. The class notes will be provided by the concerned faculty, they'll make sure that they covered every topic before the exams. For an average learner, it is not that difficult to pass the exams, to be honest.

Name: Anirudh Bhatnagar
Heading: NIT Patna Review
Review: The college has a record of 100% placement. the placement record was one of the main reasons that I choose to be part of NIT Patna. The college placement committee is very professional and very supportive for students. The committee guides the students during the placement. The highest package for our batch went up to 15 LPA and the average package was around 10 LPA. Companies like HDFC Bank, Bharat Petroleum, Microsoft, Samsung, SAP Labs, Infosys, Wipro, Oracle, Microsoft, IBM, TCS, L&T, etc visited the campus during the college placement drive. I also received a package of 12 LPA from Wipro which was a dream come true and all thanks to NIT Patna.

Name: Huzur Ali
Heading: Medical College is BEST.
Review: For every year around 30k fees are to be submitted to the administrative authority. The books are very costly. We have to buy dresses and aprons with our own money. The college canteen is there for the benefit of students during leisure time. On an average per month, expenditure is around 7k including our own expenditures. Minority scholarship is there. Through minority scholarship, we can earn around 30 k per year.

Name: Manas Chuphal
College: Graphic Era Hill University Bhimtal Campus - [GEHU]
Heading: The College life is awesome in GRAPHIC ERA
Review:
I did choose this course because I have an interest in computer applications as well as web development
Faculty members are very helpful towards students.
Many teachers present on the campus are PhD holders. Teaching methods are good compared to other colleges.
Term exams are annually and it's a bit difficult to pass.

Name: Student (Anonymous)
Heading: Honest Review of Taki Govt College
Review:
In our Taki College, I have not seen any big cultural programs in 3 years. The only festival I have seen celebrated by the college is Saraswati Puja. And student union also organized teacher's day. But we did not have any fresher's ceremony, convocation ceremony any cultural programs where all department students can join. This is very disheartening. I must say please if you have the option, take admission to other colleges.
We have a very good library but our librarian's behaviour is rude. And you can take the book home after getting a library card. However, our library consists of a large variety of books. From departmental books to novels, comics, journals, short stories etc.
We did not have any kind of campus in our college and we did not have space in front of our college. So no sports activity happens here.
We have a student union group but they are polite and helpful in needs.

Name: Aditya
College: Guru Jambheshwar University of Science and Technology - [GJUS&T]
Heading: Gju cse branch
Review:
Computer science has a vast scope and is further expanding day by day. Cse class have 120 seats in which boys to girl ratio is approx 4:1.
Faculty is well experienced, many of them have completed PhD in their respective field and some are assistant professors as well.
Exams difficulty is not that much, but one must have to be attentive in class or you could miss some important points

Name: Student (Anonymous)
Heading: Diploma in pharmacy
Review:
Annual fests are conducted yearly wise, like a sports events, dance events, workshops and many more.
The library is full of course books and you can issue the books according to your study need.

There are numerous extracurricular activities like dance club, singing, sports complex, badminton complex in the university, you can go and play there.
There are some social groups run by students for organizing the events in the university.

Heading: Desiring for a college for great pesonaltiy developement and IT Oppurtunities

There are Many Clubs for ptople with various intersers like Coding,Music, Singing, 2 Dance Clubs, 2 Deama clubs, Club for Communtion skills etc.

Name: Vikas
Heading: Overall good college
Review: College provided us with internship opportunities. In the 5th semester students goes for an internship program with tcs, Wipro, Infosys, etc. This year 1 student of cmrit takes an off-campus internship with google. Overall good for internship.

Heading: Nice college for engineering
Review:

There's a library in college with books related to courses provided in the college.

For sports, the college conducts inter college sports competitions. There's no in house sports fest.
There are different club for students, sports, cultural, academic and photography club.

College: G L Bajaj Institute of Technology and Management
Heading: GLBITM review
Review:
The student is eligible for campus placements after 4 semesters. 
Many companies visited our college such as Infosys etc
The maximum package this year is 36 lakh by Infosys and 2 students got 28 lakh package
There is 100 percent placement in my course.

Name: satyajit singh
Heading: college review of lpu university

Name: Meghana Rachel

Name: Dwiti Joshi
Heading: MBA JOURNEY

Name: Tanu Dewan
College: Symbiosis Institute of Digital and Telecom Management - [SIDTM]

Name: Rhit Sharma
Heading: NIT Manipur Review
Review: The college also provides good placement. Frankly speaking, I did not expect such a good placement record. The college committee is very helpful and supportive the members of the committee are well experienced and they guide students throughout the placement drive. during our batch around 40 companies visited our campus. Companies like Microsoft, Intuit, 314e, Infoedge, Click Labs, Publicis Sapient, TCS, Wipro, Infosys, etc visited the campus during the placement drive of the college. The highest package during our batch went up to 20 LPA and the average package was around 9 LPA. I also received a package of 16 LPA from Microsoft.

Name: Vivek Agnihotri
Heading: NIT Nagaland Review
Review: The placement record of the college is descent and the placement cell of the college is good and well experienced. So we don't have to face any kind of problem during our placement program. Companies like Cognizant, Capgemini, Lakshaya, Vedanta, L&T, Toppers, Mphasis, etc are a few companies that visited our campus during the placement drive. Name: Ojas Prashant Jhawar

Name: Sourav
Heading: GEHU- Review
Review:
1:- having an interest in computers led me to choose this course.
2:-there are not enough faculty (one faculty) who have to complete the syllabus in roughly 4-5 sections of the student.
3:-faculties are well qualified. Most of them have a good experience of teaching.
But a major problem is that in the CSE branch most of the time faculties are interchanged.
Faculties are not placed as per their quality.
 they have just filled the vacated positions.
Honestly, it feels that 6 months are not enough to complete the syllabus of one semester.
Roughly Mid sem are conducted after 1.5 months into the semester and end-term are conducted after 5 months. University provides semester timetable. During the corona period, online exams were timely completed. 
But as the offline year started there was a major gap in syllabus completion and exams.
syllabus was not completed.
Exams are not that tough to face, apart from a few subjects most of them ask basic to high-level questions depending on a particular subject.

Name: Prithwinil Mukherjee
Heading: Studying Bsc in Molecular Biology & Biotechnology in Kalyani Mahavidyalay, my experience.
Review:
Molecular biology (though my course was B.Sc. in Molecular Bio and Biotech) is an emerging field as well as beneficial for humanity, besides these facts, I chose this subject to enrich myself with knowledge about this field.
Faculty number is less compared to the number of students studying the course( 4 teachers:40+ students)
Faculties are highly educated, two of them have Ph.D. & extremely skilled in teaching and the practical experiments taught in the labs.
Exams(both internals and semesters) are timely. Each sem is taken within 5-6 months of the previous, Kalyani University(to which this college is affiliated)conducts the exams with great discipline and questions are of good standards, students need to work hard to score decent in the exams(including vivas & practical's)Overall coaching pattern is truly good. But they need to increase lab practice so that students get more chances to learn & practice the experiments & improve their lab work, which is essential in this field

The fee is based on a semester basis you have to pay the fee per semester.
The scholarship is also given on a performance basis like college topper, department topper.
Financial assistance is given based on the financial condition of the student.

Name: Aashna
Heading: College life
Review: I got yes. 50 pec   scholarship because of my 12 grades that was 90 percentage soo I got 50 percent scholarship and no financial assistance and I am doing no job in campus right now but I will do in upcoming days

Name: Student (Anonymous)
Heading: IN SHORTS ABOUT TCEA
Review:
I chose this course because I wanted to an Er in the future.
Faculty members are much supportive and the ratio is quite generous.
The maximum of the professors are Ph.D. holders and are Supportive.
In each semester there consist of two exams 1.mid term and another is 2 . Finals along with the internal exams that are taken as class tests.

Name: Shivani Surolia
College: Poornima Institute of Engineering  and Technology - [PIET]
Heading: Best private engineering college in Jaipur for B.Tech
Review: There are many groups in this college like a literary club, cytron club, udaan club, etc. They provide many fests like aarohan, dandiya nights, hackathons, etc. The library is getting full of books, and you can easily find with the software where books are placed. I had a feel-good experience to be in this college.

Name: Mahima
Heading: Jims kalkaji review: Overall it's a great business school
Review:
The course curriculum is vast and a bit longer as we have 6semester of 3months each and 2yeat PGDM program and apart from the academic syllabus there are other courses as well like python, ms excel, digital marketing. 
Faculty members are overall very cooperative and very trained and subject knowledge is good. 
Term exams were 3months each.

Name: Manish
Heading: A review of Dtu from a Dtuian.
Review:
I have choosen this course, computer engineering, because i am interested in computer and its vast uses, also, the placement stats of this course are considered to be best. Faculty here are knowledgeable but most of the time student has to study on their own because many a time syallabus is not completed on the time and sometimes teachers leave the class before the ending time. Student-teacher ratio is around 75. In my class there are 75 students like most of the class as I have confirmed from some of my friends.
Most of the teachers here are highly qualified having a ton of experience, some of the teachers are teaching from past 30-35 years. Teaching methods are somewhat traditional and somewhat modern, mix of both. They use good amount of technologies to teach the students. For term exams, since I am still in 1st semester, so, there have not been term tests till now. But as my seniors have told me about exams, they are not considered, that much hard to pass.

Name: Sowmiya K
Heading: SRC - "The Temple of Learning disciplines"
Review: Every year our college cultural, sports day, college union inauguration will be conducted and we used to participate in all the events in an enthusiastic manner. All kinds of books are available in our college library like ethics, history, competitive exam books, etc., Many journals, magazines, and newspapers are available and our library is an excellent place for studying. Sports activities like yoga, Karathae, Silambam, kho-kho, volleyball, football, kabaddi, athletes, etc., Students involved in extracurricular activities like NCC, NSS, YRC.Save Green Club in association with osica international, Japan which is run by the students of our department, programs are conducted on every science day. Prizes and certificates are given to the students, which increases the leadership qualities of our students.

Name: Ashwani Dhar Dwivedi
College: Shri Ramswaroop Memorial College of Engineering and Management -  [SRMCM]
Heading: Our College Diary
Review:
There are many fests are organized like gantavya, abhiyakti, fresher nights, DJ nights they are held between July to October.
Our library is in a good condition, you can read or do self-study. The timing is from 9 am to 8 pm.
In sports, last year zonal was conducted at my college. Our classroom is also in good condition.
There are many clubs like gorobots, dance and singing clubs.

Name: Student (Anonymous)
Heading: All about NSUT you need to know
Review: The campus is so good there are a lot of trees and nice playgrounds also the cultural fest is good but due to covid it is not being conducted for some years. The library is vast or has a lot of books almost every book you need is available. Me classrooms are so good also sports facilities are good. There are a lot of socities which you can join societies related to tech or dance and many others based on your interest you can join any of them.

Name: Student (Anonymous)
Heading: NSUT REVIEW
Review: till now I am not eligible for an internship because I am in the 4th semester. after completion of the 4th sem, students are given internship opportunities based on their GPA and skills. many companies for eg. google, Atlassian, etc. provide job opportunities to the students

Name: Sivalakshimi
Heading: MY SRC MY PRIDE
Review: The entire campus is filled with trees which provides fresh air and a green environment. It's clean and neat. My college has a massive open air theatre and closed auditorium too. Big playground, water and sanitation facilities, solar panels are there. There is a big library in which thousands of books are there to enrich our student's knowledge. Our classroom is big and spacious and it's attached to a smartboard. The students are involved in many extracurricular activities like NSS, NCC, YRC and sports. Every year college union inauguration and cultures will be conducted. We used to participate in that with happiness. Clubs include save the green club, student union, student discipline committee etc are the best platform for the students to exhibit their talents.

Name: SAITY BANERJEE
College: Symbiosis Centre for Management and Human Resource Development - [SCMHRD]
Heading: SCHMRD, Pune will make sure that you get opportunities to grow both personally and professionally
Review: I am currently pursuing MBA in operations from SCHMRD, Pune as it is one of the most amazing colleges for the same. The college offers decent placement packages and also ample opportunities to grow and learn. The faculties I feel are highly educated and also try to engage and motivate students by introducing new ways of learning. Exams are conducted after every trimester.

Name: Monica Parmar
Heading: Things to know  before Addmission in SDCET, Ghaziabad.
Review:
Mr and Miss Fresher, Annual Deep Mahotsav, farewell and multidimensional events are conducted every year. once in 2 or 3 years sports activities at the regional level are conducted. Quiz competitions are organised annually. Programs are conducted by collaborating with other colleges of Sunderdeep college. All colleges are placed on the same campus only, only buildings and workshops are different. 
A good campus area promotes well growth opportunities. There are 2 canteens on the campus with all required facilities, but they are a little crowded. College is very well connected to the highway so no difficulty in commutation. College buses are also provided in case you want to consider them but are expensive plus the timings are rigid.
Books are available,  sometimes you have to wait for a specific book but that's normal. At a time 4books can be available. NO BOOK bank available. If demand for a book is there, they will buy the book also.

Name: Shashank Sharma
Heading: Umesh Chandra College of Commerce
Review: All the faculty members are just top notch. Many doctorates also take classes in undergraduate courses. Each class has a mentor/counsellor for the students to guide them academically and support them emotionally. There is no scope for rot learning, every concept is explained through its practical application via the use of technology like excel sheets, presentations, etc. In the first year, a subject for holistic development is also taught for students all round development. Term exams are conducted right on time. There are no delays in the commencement of the examination. Semester wise calendars are issued to keep the track of the courses right on time. Exams are not difficult to pass at all if have paid attention in the regular classes and have done the self study in due time. 40% is the passing criteria in all the subjects. Further separate marks are given for assignments, attendance and mid-terms which are eventually aggregated in the final semester examination.

Name: Student (Anonymous)
College: Shri Govindram Seksaria Institute of Technology and Science- [SGSITS]
Heading: A complete Guide
Review: Fees for the Electrical engineering depatment in our college is 91500 for a year. The scholarship we get is Mukhya Mantri Medhavi Vidhyarthi Yojna (MMVY)  by the government of Madhya Pradesh in which we get our fees beck paid to the college.

Name: Meenu Nair
Heading: NIT Tadepalligudem Review
Review: The curriculum of NIT is quite popular for technology students but trust me management curriculum is also not behind and it is far better than many so claim B-school of India. The curriculum is divided into 4 semesters and the first two semesters are based on providing knowledge about the basic concepts of management and helping students to understand the importance of management skills in the corporate world. The last two semesters are based on industrial visits and how to apply theoretical knowledge in real-world scenarios. The last 2 semesters are based on case studies that are properly in sync with real-world scenarios, The main objective of the curriculum does develop students as future managers and leaders that can lead corporate houses from the front.

Name: Jay Shankar Prasad
Heading: III UNA Review
Review: Why I decided to be part of the Indian Institute of Information Technology Una because IIITs are very popular for their placement. Indian Institute of Information Technology Una is not behind the average package of the college goes up to 8.60 LPA and the highest package for our batch was 14.50 LPA. Companies like L&T, InfoTech, Ittiam, Greyb, Analytics Quotient, Ebiz On, First American, Grey B, Analytics, eBiz 4.0, Envestnet, Wipro, TCS, Cognizant, and Infosys are few companies that visited our campus during the placement drive. The college placement committee is also quite supportive and helpful.

Name: Sandeep Ahuja
College: Fairfield Institute of Management and Technology - [FIMT]
Heading: College has many social group and everyone is supportive
Review: The campus life of the college is very good. The college has a very good canteen where we hang out with friends. The canteen is fully air conditioned and there is a good seating arrangement. The college has many social groups and clubs which participate in any event at the college level and university level. I was part of the dance club and let to learn lots of things. For extracurricular activities, the college has a gym facility and indoor sports. The infrastructure of the college is good. Labs and library of the college have very well setup.

Name: Dip Pramanik
Heading: Honest experience in WBSU
Review:
Our university does not organize many cultural programs. They do not encourage extra circular activities. we did not have any kind of annual fest & fresher's welcome. 
We have a huge library with all kinds of books available. But many more books to come because I have seen many department's books are missing. However, it's a great place & very well decorated with colorful racks.
Our university campus is very good but people who are sitting in the official work department are the worst. Their behavior is very bad. They will harass you for small problems. You can't solve your problem in one day. They just keep giving another date. It is very much awful.
We did not have any kind of sports activity. At least I have not seen anything. Lastly I want to say if you came here with lot of dreams and expectation you will be very much disappointed.

Name: Sushruth
College: IIM Ranchi Indian Institute of Management
Heading: Multiple opportunities are provided
Review:
The course curriculum is nicely structured as per the industry requirements. It includes a complete analytics curriculum starting from the very basics which makes it easy for any non enthusiastic person to turn around. My previous experience as Python Developer made me attracted to analytics and so I chose this course. Faculty to student ratio is nearly 1:~4-5 for this batch (considering only IS faculty and BA students)
All the faculty are highly qualified in the domain and they carry rich teaching experience. They follow very practical approaches in teaching. 
The course is spread across 2 years with 6 terms in complete. Each term is for nearly 12-14 weeks.
Proper listening to class regularly and practising the classwork would be sufficient for easy passing in exams. I don't think passing is a difficult task for once who got admission into the college.

Name: Aravinda Halvi
Heading: A gIIFTed college
Review:
MBA in International Business - the only college in India to provide this degree. The USP of the institute is its trade subjects.
The average class size is 50 students. 
The faculties are really great and have Ph. D degrees from various prestigious universities which them the best people to be taught from.
6 trimesters - 6 end term exams and midterms depend on respective faculty
Difficulty level of exams - moderate

Name: Bhargavi Dhoble
College: Dr. YSR National Institute of Tourism and Hospitality Management - [NITHM]
Heading: Progressive- NITHM
Review: Our college provides an internship of all the relevant types to the students. They provide hotel internships in 5-star hotels such as Taj Falaknuma, Taj Deccan, Oberoi hotels, Radisson Blu, Heritage Hotels, etc. There they teach and train students about all the work at all the departments of the hotel including the etiquette and the golden rules to be followed in a hotel, make them learn and perform some tasks and students make notes every day as a journal. Our college provides internships for event management. There, students are being trained for food and beverage mostly and to work with the event manager and learn the strategy to plan, execute and train the employees. Then, there is an opportunity for tourism internships such as tour walks, tour guides, recruiting, etc. Here, students are trained to gather information about all the famous places in that area and talk professionally with tourists. The last one is for sales and marketing internship where students are connected with marketing strategies.

Name: Karan Suvarna
College: Thakur Institute of Management Studies and Research - [TIMSR]
Heading: PGDM Finance - TIMSR
Review: TIMSR has many national and international conferences conducted for the benefit of the business students all year round. Other fests are Evoke, Ekvatam, and Pulse where Evoke is the annual intercollege fest for management, ekvatam is the cultural fest and pulse is a sports event. All are conducted on a grand scale and are very exciting to participate in and also watch. There are student bodies such as Student Council and clubs related to various filed such a marketing, finance, HR, etc.

Name: RIYA GUPTA
Heading: Decent B-School
Review: The campus of jims is quite small, Though basic amenities are available within the campus. The classrooms are well furnished and air-conditioned They have smart boards and blackboards Library is there with books related to your course and you can issue them anytime there is no sports room playground in the campus Several clubs run by the students and headed by a faculty Marketing club, finance club, Hr club many more.

Name: Kush
Heading: MBA at IMT Ghaziabad
Review: So far, I've found the course curriculum to be both good and bad. PPTs and guest lectures are used to teach us the majority of the time. The amount of time spent reading books is relatively limited. This programme offers five different specializations. Professors at IMT adhere to the principles of learning pedagogy. As the course progresses, we will be handed assignments. We were also required to present on the topics discussed in class.

Name: RISHAV BOSE
Heading: In a glimpse: The Heritage College
Review:
After having pursued Commerce in my +2, I wanted to do my graduation in Commerce and hence opted for BCom(Hons.)

The Heritage College has undoubtedly one of the best set of teachers in the entire city. Almost all the teachers are pretty young, well versed in the subjects and extremely student-friendly. The Heritage College always believes in beyond-the-classroom education and hence there are WhatsApp groups with the teachers who’d help you with your subjects and college life at any given point during the day.

Classes were never limited to a chalkboard-textbook basis and several other interactive methods of teaching were always preferred by the teachers.

Interpersonal relations with the faculty is one of the best pros of The Heritage College as the teachers end up being like your family.

Exams were conducted twice before every semester and students were given one-on-one classes with the teachers if they faced any difficulty. Overall, every student passed the exams.

Name: Manya
College: Jagannath International Management School - [JIMS] Vasant Kunj
Heading: JIMS , Vasant kunj
Review: The social life is superb for the students. We have a canteen on the campus to hang out with our friends have some amazing food. There are many events that are regularly conducted for students. There is a library for books. We have so many curricular activities in which we can participate in also if you're interested in sports it's a good college for you. There are various societies for students of different interests.

Name: Student (Anonymous)
College: IIM Rohtak Indian Institute of Management
Heading: IIM Rohtak-Review
Review: On average, the faculty-to-student ratio is at 1:50. All of the faculty members hold PhDs from prestigious Indian universities, and their expertise and knowledge are unrivalled, which distinguishes IIM Rohtak from the majority of India's business schools. The majority of the teaching is done through case studies, which assist students understand how industries are changing. The programme is tailored to help students improve their understanding at various levels. It taught us how to work effectively in difficult and dynamic situations. All of the academics were doctorates holders in their fields.

Name: CHITTRIETA GORAIN
Heading: MDI Gurgaon: Leaders of Management Studies
Review: We offer a beautiful, modern campus with all of the greatest amenities, including cafeterias, clubs, committees, labs, and other amenities. The library includes a wide range of printed and electronic items, including books, e-journals, and other resources. On-campus, there are clubs such as the Activity Club, Finance Club, Music society, cultural cells, events Club. MDI's main annual fest; Imperium, is a grand three-day event.

Name: Raima
College: IIT Jodhpur - Indian Institute of Technology - [IITJ]
Heading: MBA at IIT Jodhpur
Review: It is basically a two years flagship program and this MBA degree is. First, the curriculum focussed on the fundamental studies in the discipline of finance, marketing, strategy, operations, entrepreneurship, and human resource management. In the final year, we concentrated on our elective courses. In the second year, I chose an MBA technology degree. Under this elective area, I read subjects related to tech-intensive areas focussed on tech application for business, tech leadership, and analytics and data. I got the opportunity to learn from our excellent core faculty members along with the brilliant guest or visiting faculty. Currently, I’m in my final year and got to develop skills in the area of interpersonal communication, negotiation, organizational development, leadership, etc. I also learned while working on the corporate live project provided by the Corporate Relation Centre (CRC).

Name: KARTIKEYA DUBEY
Heading: Excellent Read
Review:
As I had an interest in this Course. 
For each subject, there is a seperate faculty and also there is a mentor for each and every Student. 
The Teaching method is advanced and also the course is in up to date manner according to trends in Hotels. 
The Term exams are very easy and one can easily pass these exams.

Name: sagar singh rauthan
Heading: GEHU- Review
Review:
I chose this course because after doing BTech there are a lot more opportunities through which students can apply for most of the technical competitive exams and as well as graduate level competitive exams 
2. We have  6 subjects in every semester and for each subject, there are 2 faculty allotted  one will take theory classes and another will take practical classes  the faculty-student ratio is 2:64
3. All faculties are highly educated from prestigious universities having degrees of bachelor's and as well as of masters and some faculty have also done Ph.D. in there respective subjects.
4. We have a total of 8 semesters 1 semester of 6 months in which students have to give 2 exams 1st one is a midterm examination which is of 50 marks for each subject and there are 6 subjects in every semester and 2nd exam was Ens term examination which is of 100 marks and after each mid&end exams there will be practical of some subjects remember you will be going back in both theory as well as in practical yes it is difficult.

Name: Vizovono Medoze
Heading: IIM Lucknow review
Review: The fees at the institution are hiked by approximately 5-7%. The overall funding for the college isn't as difficult because of being under the Government of India. With a fee of around Rs.20 lakhs, it is easier to get an educational loan on the same because the college is one of the Top 5 MBA colleges in India. The college also provides further assistance on acquiring low interest loans from partner banks and also provides scholarship opportunities for students belonging to the low income category.

Name: GANDHIMATHI S
Heading: Amazing College For Gain Knowledge
Review:
Every Year They Conducted Annual Function and Cultural Celebration for Shown their Extra-Curricular activities and their Interests in them.

This College Library has a lot of Good Books for Study Purpose as well as gain Our Social Knowledge too and also it was a Huge Library.

Well, Talented Sports Students were always welcome to join this college because Sports Faculties were Given an amazing Practice for students to Develop their Carrier in Sports Activities as well as they Given the importance for Extra Curricular activities too.

They did a lot of social club activities like NSS, NCC, YRC, etc.

The teaching method is too good evening facility is available in all classes teachers are also too experienced and good. There are four exams are held in a year. 2 exams are just for formality and 2 exams are half-yearly exams.

Review: The campus life of Andhra "University is very pleasant and soothing. The college has Volleyball, Badminton, Basketball, and tennis court.
